column5: Same for me too. Feeling really overwhelmed or stressed seems to be the main trigger

Ugh this really got to me tonight. I always wonder how different my life could have been. I could have carried on being that super happy 7 year old girl and now Iâ€™ll never know how her life could have turned out because someone took that all away from me.

Uk here! Thereâ€™s no harm to talk to her first about having something you want to talk about but worrying that she might feel the need to transfer you. I think more than likely sheâ€™s going to work with you throughout this process but it just might make it that little bit easier to get some reassurance from her before you tell her. If youâ€™re struggling to get the words out then take some time out before your next session and write it all down. My counsellor encourages me to even write things down during sessions and let him read it if Iâ€™m struggling to talk about something. 
Even if she does end up transferring you onto someone else, i know it can be really shit but you might even find it easier and more beneficial in the long run to talk to someone who specially specialises in that area. 
I hope all goes well for you! X

No rivalry but I moved away, only about an hour from them and ever since it was always me going over to visit them and they would never make the effort to visit me. It got to the point where they didnâ€™t bother so neither did I

I think at the time of being in therapy there are so many different emotions and feelings going on that itâ€™s often hard to get across what it is you want to say exactly. I often go away from therapy and think â€˜ah I should have said that betterâ€™ or â€˜I should have said that in a different wayâ€™ you could go into the next session and before you start say something like â€˜you know you asked last week if I trusted youâ€™ and then tell them how you feel. My therapist knows how much I trust him and Iâ€™ve told him so many times that he knows things about me that the closest person to me doesnâ€™t even know and he really appreciates knowing how much trust I have in him.
Yeah I totally get it. I have them too!
When I wake up from a nightmare Iâ€™ll spend some time doing some grounding techniques and then grab some water and go outside to calm down for 5/10 minutes before going back to bed

Iâ€™d maybe go in with the list in terms of your highest priority in what you want to talk about just so the things that are bothering you the most you have a chance to talk about. 
Also bring this up with your therapist at the beginning of your session and go through and list everything thatâ€™s on your mind in a summary because then at least youâ€™ve said it and you may feel a little better just getting it out there even if you donâ€™t get round to talking about it that session.
Iâ€™m not a counsellor or anything but I just wanted to say sorry that happened to your friend. Look after yourself and take care over the next week until you get to see a counsellor.
Iâ€™m still struggling with this one.. 9 years later ğŸ¥º

Iâ€™m a bit late to the party, sorry! But I would talk to your boss about it and try and come up with something that works for you both. I wouldnâ€™t be able to just simply go for the therapy session and go back to work because I need time to process it afterwards and some sessions can get quite deep so think about where youâ€™ll want to be after your therapy appointments. If you try and squeeze it in to your lunch hour Iâ€™m worried youâ€™ll be rushing around and donâ€™t get time to process what youâ€™ve talked about and how youâ€™re feeling. Thank you. I really needed that â¤ï¸
